div3.head: Three hundred Dollars reward.
div3.p:
--Ran away from the subscriber, on the 29th of December last, a negro woman named Sarah.
Said negro a stout built, of gingerbread color, about 29 years of age, and will probably weigh 150 pounds. She is possibly making an effort to escape to the Yankee, or it may be that she is lurking about the city and attempting to pass as free.
I will give the above reward for her return to me in Richmond, or confinement in jail so that I get her again.

div4.p:
25 Dollars Reward will be paid for the apprehension and delivery to me of Milton, a negro boy, about 17 years of age, stout built, brown skin, large eyes, and has a thick head of hair.
War seen in the last few days lurking about the city.
P. S.--I have for hire the present year, several Negroes, among them a good Driver, Farm, and Factory hand, and several Girls, good House Servants.
div4.closer:
Apply to Jno A Hutcheson,
or Thos W Ballow, at the State Court-house. ja 9--ts

div3.head: Two hundred and fifty Dollars reward.
div3.p:
--Ran away, during the holidays, my boy Gerard, about 26 years old, 5 feet 5 or 6 inches high, dark gingerbread color, bushy head of hair, very likely and genteel in appearance, and well dressed.
No doubt he is in company with his brother, Plummer, whom I cold to Mr Johnson a few weeks since, and who ran away from him about the same time.
I will pay the above reward for Gerard if delivered to me here, or lodged in any jail where I can get him.

div3.head: Runaway--$300 reward
div3.p:
--On the 4th instant, a large, dark skin Woman, named Margaret, between 30 and 35 years of age. She had on a green dress when she left.
She may be endeavoring to make her way to North Carolina or Tennessee.
I will pay the above reward if caught in Virginia, of $500 if caught out of the State and put in Fondren's jail in Richmond.
div3.closer:
Lee &James,
For Richard lurper. ja 5--15t+

div3.head: Runaway.
div3.p:
--$100 reward offered for negro man Walter, who ran away some time last summer and has lately been heard of in Richmond.
He belongs to Mrs Parham, of Lynchburg; is about five feet high, of a dark brown color, with a scar on be chin.
The above reward will be paid if he is secured in jail in Richmond, or delivered at the bookstore of

div3.head: Run away
div3.p:
--From my residence, on 27th December, 1863, my negro man Shedrick; he is about twenty- five years old, of a gingerbread color, has a scar on his face, is about six feet high, and wears his hair very long and plaited, and is knock-kneed.
I will give a reward of fifty dollars for his return to me in Chesterfield county, Va. or $25 if lodged in jail, so that I can get him.

div3.head: 500 Dollars reward.
div3.p:
--Left my residence, near the Forest Depot, Bedford county, a Negro Man, named Eaton He is about 27 years old, tall, and rather raw-boned; dark gingerbread color, had on a soft black felt hat, and carried his winter clothes with him, which were of a greenish color I will pay $200 if taken in the counties of Bedfort or Campbell, and $300 if taken anywhere else and placed in a place of safety, or delivered to me at my residence.
Address me at Forest Depot, Bedford county, Va.

div3.head: Notice.
div3.p: --Persons who have furnished substitutes, and are now liable to military service, are afforded an opportunity of entering the Marion Corps by calling on the undersigned at the Quartermaster's office, No. 115 Broad street.

div3.head:
Headq'rs Mongan's cavalry,
Decatur, Ga, Jan. 1, 1864
div3.p: Soldiers.--I am once more among you, after a long and painful imprisonment.
I am anxious to be again in the field I, therefore call on all the soldiers of my command to assemble at once at the rendezvous which has been established at this place.
Your country needs your services; the field of operation is wide, and the future glorious, if we only deserve it.

Remember how many of your brave comrades are still pining in a felon's cell.
They call loudly as you for help.
They expect it of you. Will you disappoint them?
Come at once, and come cheerfully, for I want no man in my command who has to be sent to his duty by a provost marshal.

The work before us will be arduous, and will require brave hearts and willing hands.
Let us met falter or delay, for no time is to be lost.
Every one must bring his horse and gun who Those who cannot will have them furnished.
div3.closer:
John H Morgan
Brigadier General P A C S
Official: R A Aneton Lt Col and A A A G. ja 2--10t

div3.head:
Hdq'rs Dep't,
Corner 19th and Franklin sts
Richmond, Va, dec. 16th
div3.p: Notice to those having Negroes to Hire.--The Engineer Department will hire for year 1,000 hands for work on fortifications, &c.
Rate of pay fixed by Commissioners for Virginia.
Hire of laborers, clothing and rations furnished by the Government, $500 per year.
Hire of laborers, clothing and rations furnished by the owner, $500 per year.
Hire of laborers, rations only furnished by the Government, $400 per year.
Hire of laborers, rations only furnished by the Government, $30 per month.
This Department will pay transportation to Richmond or Petersburg, and will give in addition $5 for expenses for each negro delivered by sheriffs or citizens at either place.

Negroes to be comfortably clad and in good condition when received.
Apply until 1st of February next.
The Government will be responsible for slaves for hired under the common law of Virginia.
div3.closer:
By order of Col W H Stevens.
Jno A Williams
Major Reg'rs in charge ja --
